alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 11:41AM CST until February 06 at 4:35PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County. .Flooding continues on the Catoma Creek and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands in the vicinity of the U.S. 331 Highway Bridge occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CST Saturday was 22.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
